channel.title: Comments for page "Ranking Guide"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Ranking Guide"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I think that's just for Stamina boosters, so using a +100% AP/XP/Rep/Ryo booster should be fine. Though, it won't help your Ranking XP directly, it gives you some extra Ryo to throw at the Party Room.

item.title: Add a n00b warning in the Stamina section
item.content:encoded: Add a warning against using Boosters (link that) noting that booster use kicks you off the rankings for the day. From personal experience, a n00b can overlook that warning.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
There is an option in the PH for it, and they do stack.

As for the last one, it's only on missions.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
A few questions by a n00b:
1)loli loli - how is it used? do you run a normal mission and use it, and after that the party house?
2)do loli loli and catgirl entourage stack?

3)Finally, the Arena favorite: Does it work on all ranking xp (silver pots, party house, and missions) or just missions?

item.title: Easy way to Sannin
item.content:encoded:
I just completed my S1 Sannin Run the easy way.
You just need a Hollow Leg, 9 Silver Elixirs and about 36000 Ryo. You can brew the Silver Elixir yourself, if you have enough Silver Petals and you can get these in no time with Shorty and Strawberry in your team and "I need this" as default jutsu.
Wait around for Festival Day, chug 4 Silver Elixirs, ride the Bargletron, get a Diet Ramen, chug another 5 Elixirs. That puts you at 900,000 Ranking XP. Throw an All-Out Bash or two at the Party House and you've got 1,000,000 Ranking XP without wasting a single Stamina point :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: No, the warning for MegaMissions specifically says that Missions lose their Mega-ness over Dayroll and just become regular missions.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Dunno if it might actually work, but you could start a megamission (maybe even Act as a Kage one) before dayroll and finish it after dayroll, with all the bonuses you can get.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yeah, but he also insinuated that you could keep going on the party house to get number one on the ranking. That's where my main point was.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: isnt one mil all you need to go sannin anyway?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Ranking via the party house doesn't work anymore dude. McM put a cap on the party house ranking for that very reason. I managed to, in one day, get well over 10 million ranking simply by partying. A few days later, he put a cap of one million on the ranking from there.

item.title: Easy Ranking
item.content:encoded: Heres how I did mine. Day 1, do missions with Strawberry, Shorty, and Olmek. Mainly do A Rank missions an a S rank if you have it, and use a jutsu for more ryo. At the end of the day, turn the silver petals into silver elixirs, these are for backup. On day 2, run missions with allies that are easy to get hangouts with, I.E. Z-Dog, lucky star trio, etc. This will get you nadeshiko. Learn her jutsu for double party house rewards. If you have catgirl entourage, then this will be cheap. This is where money comes into it. Start partying at the expensive one using nadeshikos jutsu (I think it was loli loli or something) The first time should give you 400000 ranking xp, and every aditional one will give you 200000. After 4 tries it should be enough. Now if you cant afford it, use your silver elixirs. This should top you off if you're going for Sannin. If you're going for number 1 on the rankings, keep going, sell un-needed items. Hopefully this has helped.

item.title: FailPotion
item.content:encoded:
FailPotion is a viable option for use on an OoT run, but depending on how well set up your char is, it could be a gamble.

To beat the value of a silver elixir right now, only golden potion can manage it, and only if you can produce more than ~7200 ranking per mission, if one assumes you only spend 7 stam per mission. With the FP, on the same standard you'd only need to produce 3.5k. On the other hand, if you can manage 72, those 14 missions you'll get from the 100 stam will net you Just over 100k, which is double the value of a silver, for 25% of the appetite cost after greasemonkeys. Of course, there's a fair chance you'll have 10 appetite floating after you do your silver shots too. The question is, does it make it worth the 3-range/str/levels? I don't have any hard numbers handy, but if you can use it after all your other grinds, I'd say possibly yes.

EDUT1: minor cleanup
EDUT2: There's a bit of conflicting info here, so I'll drop a confirmation: Loli Loli Bonus! +100% Friend Points / Daily XP! -25 Stamina!

item.title: (no title)

When people posted them, they didn't set up the formatting properly so now you have footnote 1 linking nowhere, footnote 2 linking nowhere, and then a second footnote 1 that is properly formatted linking to the footnote 1.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: each silver elixir is worth 100k Ranking XP… so 1m/100k = 10. if you use the greassmonkeys (-10 appetite) they'll cost 40 appetite each (otherwise 50) and so you'll need either 400 appetite with the team or 500 appetite without the team. (with the new appetite awesome it's entirely possible to get 1 million Ranking xp just from potions now.)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The top party (all-out bash) randomly gives 50K or 100K ranking. Catgirls or Perfect Evolution doubles that, both triple it. The cost starts at 18K and increases by 18K after every two parties you do (i.e. 18K, 18K, 36K, 36K, 54K, etc.).

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: That depends on the team, and how much you can average if you have a team that involves one or two of the stamina giving people. And As for the price for a direct buy… it is over 1 million ryo without catgirl or the perfect evolution jutsu. With both of them, it goes way down. On my run, I had over 1K stamina, and partied with over 1.5 million ryo. I hit close to 8 million ranking. Most of that was from parties.

item.title: Parties
item.content:encoded: How much do the different parties give for ranking? Is there some formula to worry about there? About how much would it cost to 'buy' your way directly to the recommended 3+ million ranking?

item.title: Golden Potion vs Silver Elixirs
item.content:encoded: Now that's assuming you don't smoke bomb out of the low ranking missions. Most people won't, but if you take into account that, the golden potions are ever so slightly better. Of course by that time, you would be investing a ton into smoke bombs and said golden potions to try and get 3 to 4 mil ranking. And of course, you would be crazy to do that. Unless you wanted to maximize your ranking for that day to either show off or do something else, which, by that time, you probably wouldn't need to do.

item.title: Golden Potion vs Silver Elixirs
item.content:encoded:
Okay! For this example, we have 360 appetite, and +35% Ranking XP (note rush/arena favorite).

Sannin + Legacy + Hollow Leg + Palmface(bingo) + Diet Ramen = 360 Appetite.
Grab some Greassmonkeys (-10 appetite).

Silver Elixirs now cost 40 app apiece. 360/40 = 9. Nine Silver Elixirs = 900,000 RXP.
Compare this to Golden Potions.

Goldens cost 90 app apiece. 360/90 = 4. So, 1000 Stamina, or 100 missions.
If you're using pinky2/stalkergirl and your village has a sand demon monument, you get +3 Stam per mission, or 300 Stamina, or 30 extra missions. And again, 90 Stamina, or 9 extra missions. And again, 27 stamina, or two extra missions. And again, 6 Stamina + 7 leftover is one extra mission.
So +1000 Stamina, with the right team, becomes 142 missions.
With +35% Ranking, each AA-rank mission is worth ~6000 Rxp.
142 * 6000 = 852,000 rxp.
This is assuming you pass every single mission, and that you win enough Syntax Error missions to make up for the ones that are +5732, or +5854, or +5906. More likely, you're looking at ~820,000.

When it comes to appetite and ranking, silver elixir always wins.
Silver v Golden: 900,000 > 852,000.
Silver v Super: 300,000 > 84,000
Silver v Ultra: 300,000 > 48,000
Diet Ramen(+1 Silver) v Teriyaki Ramen(+100stam): 100,000 > 84,000

And they're easy to get, too! My Season One Silver Setup is like this:
Team: Strawberry Shorty2 and Spot. Jutsu: I Need This! (+100% Drop rate, 0C on regular missions). A-Rank missions until you have 112, 128, or 144 Silver Petals. Takes about one full day of stamina.

#2 Ranked s1 player yesterday… Silver for the win!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: All bonuses in the game are additive, so base+100%+10%=210%. Prior to the recode, bonuses could multiply, so there may be some old, erroneous information in the wiki, here and there.

item.title: DXP% bonuses
item.content:encoded:
Are they compound or not?
As in say I had a +100% bonus and a +10% bonus. (example here, there is no 100% bonus. Just knowing there'll probably be someone correcting me ;)
Would I get 210% total? (including 100% base)
or would I get
100%+100%=200%
+10%=220%?
(Or 100%+10%=110%+100%=220%, to prove order is irrelevant.)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: No, It only give Jutsu XP, AP and Arena Rep

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I'm happy that the guide was corrected, but I'll also write here that in the new BvS…

Obsessive Insight was nerfed and does NOT work anymore for DXP

So all that Chakra is useful for is passing hard missions and The Rack's jutsu. DXP bonuses are now only Annie lv.2 (since Timmy lv.2 was also nerfed), Arena Favorite, Note Rush, Bashes, Catgirl Entourage, Late-Night Snack and Silver Elixirs.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I would like to add that silver hairpin and hanging out with shorty on the day before run would give +100 stamina to overall. this is important factor.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I added the Boots of Walking because they are ENORMOUSLY useful if you can enhance Obsessive Insight to the point where it's 50 chakra. The BoW make it free.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: well let me add to your list if you have Streamlined Focus you can get Obsessive Insight down to 45 chakra if you then hang out with Anonymous it goes down to 23, and if you have Legacy in a village that has Spartan Battleground it is only 12 Chakra.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I was thinking for a while and came up with a question and a theory.

- How would golden potions factor into the formula? I mean +250 stamina for 100 appetite seems pretty reasonable. (+500 stamina for 200 appetite seems the best to me.)
with +1 stamina back per mission 500 stamina is about 555 total stamina (for every 10 missions you get 1 free mission)
with +2 stamina back per mission 500 stamina is about 620 total stamina (for every 10 missions you get 2 free missions)
with +3 stamina back per mission 500 stamina is about 695 total stamina (for every 10 missions you get 3 free missions)

- Also if you max out Obsessive Insight (with the Jutsu Enhancement Tower) it should cost 50 chakra (assuming max reduction is 50% of the initial 100 chakra based on the max reductions I've gotten from other jutsu) so in theory you could save stamina with the Boots of Walking and their +50 chakra per mission without the need to hang out with Anonymous.

just figured I'd toss that out there and I'm still looking for any runes that may help.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yes, the cap is at 200 stamina.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Thanks. I wasn't sure if there were any other bonuses from Ninja-mas.

One thing that should be added is improving jutsu, because as you go, you can continue to workon Obsessive Insight.
I've already improved it 3 times today before having to refill chakra. With all my bonuses, it only costs 27.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
No, it doesn't, as it only affects JXP and not AP. AP/JXP bonuses do affect ranking XP, while any bonus to JXP or AP but not both does not.

Why would it be? You'd be losing out on the +10% from Flip Out, as well as the +20/+50 stamina from the appropriate opening theme. You'd also still be getting less stamina: -150 total stamina from the themes, and only +100 stamina from the Ninja-Mas Tree sets you at -50.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Teacher's Pet doesn't affect ranking, does it?

Also, could using the filler themes be a viable option on the 25th of a month?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: First thing I did though, I got a Medicinal Herb, and got Stalkergirl, then teamed her up with Flipper. Got Chunin Rank VERY quickly.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Finished my S1 Sannin run last night. No Kaiju drops, no Trade bonuses or Obsessive Insight, no Smoke Bombs, and no Hottie Regeneration. I did have a good Village, Hollow Leg, 16 Range, and White Eye. I just took Stalker2, Pinky2, and Timmy 2, did straight Taijutsu A-Rank, and used Eleventy Billion Palms, Gentle Fist, and White Eye several times when it came up. Palms and White Eye were Jutsu Enhanced, to lower the Chakra cost. Hourly Bonuses, Anime Web Bonuses, no weekly bonus, 3 Hairpins, Teriyaki Ramen, a Super Potion, 4 Apertif, and 2 Silver Elixir later, and I had Sannin.

BTW, don't loop on the same night you do your Sannin run, or your Rank is Genin. You can do 2BA Master and possibly Cashing In tomorrow, and THEN Loop. I wish I was told about that. XP

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
You don't consider the possibly of having Boots from completing the Wasteland content in your calculations, which means that they're off a tad, as a good pair of boots will reduce stamina spent recharging chakra by a great deal, or even completely.

Edit:

Loli Loli Bonus! Double Friend Points! -25 Stamina!

No bonus to XP received when using Loli Loli to party.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I did the following calculation for non-legacy. I would like to be corrected if I'm wrong…

[*]
-15% Pinky
-15% Streamlined focus (nww item)
-10% Chakra training center (upgrade)

-35% jutsu cost (.85x.85x.9)

[*] Hanging out with annonymous

[*] Jutsu Enhancement Tower for Obsessive Insight.
for 300k jxp (or even less; it's 270k for me; maybe it's because of the mirror bonus?) you will upgrade the jutsu once.
you do that 4 times (let's say for 1.2 mil jxp) and the jutsu cost will become 100C -> 66C

Sum it all up and you have the following: ~ 22C /use.

As for xp bonuses:

  1. +10% XP (Captain's Jacket)
  2. +10% XP (Aura of Experience or Letter of Marque)
  3. +15% XP (Arena Favorite)
  4. +10% XP (Ancient Teachings)
  5. +50% XP (Obsessive Insight)
  6. +50% XP (Mister Tea)
  7. +10% XP (Flip Out theme)
  8. +20% XP (Note Rush)
  9. +20% XP (Timmy Lvl 2)

~ +545% XP

[*] 600 max chakra. (+3 stamina per charge : fox monument & blue flower hairpin; +2 stamina back from mission : pinky lvl2 & sand monument)
594C => 27 missions => 270-54+7=223 stamina
330C => 15 missions => 150-30+7=127 stamina
330C => 15 missions => 150-30+7=127 stamina
242C => 11 missions => 110-22=88 stamina
total : 68 missions, 565 stamina, 68 x 5.45 x XP (XP x 370)
